Simon Cowell for Glee character The 50-year-old actress- who plays scathing cheerleading coach Sue Sylvester on the US TV show- believes there are many similarities between the teacher and the straight-talking talent show judge. She said: If ever there was a guy who tells it like it is, then it's Simon Cowell . You could definitely look at Sue and say there's a lot of Simon Cowell in her.`` He's a great inspiration for the character of Sue- there is a lot that I can take from him and put into her. Jane Lynch also admitted she is`` amazed'' by the public's reaction to Sue and believes people admire her in the same way they respect music mogul Simon Cowell . She explained in an interview with

Thompson points out that, as a British unknown looking for American fame, Simon Cowell used meanness as a savvy PR move- one that wouldn't work for Jennifer Lopez or Steven Tyler . Outside of the music industry, no one in the United States knew who Simon Cowell was until he started making nasty comments during the first season promotions for the show, he says.`` Being mean was what made him a celebrity. states that host early presidential primary contests, fueling some speculation he might seek the White House instead. Rep. Mike Pence , R-Ind., announced Thursday that he would not run for president in 2012. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence said in a letter to supporters.`` In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012.''
